text: General Instructions
label: HH1

text: Purpose of Form
label: HH3

text: Generally, use Form 6252 to report
label: BODY

text: income from casual sales during this tax
label: BODY

text: year of real or personal property (other
label: BODY

text: than inventory) if you will receive any
label: BODY

text: payments in a tax year after the year of
label: BODY

text: sale. For years after the year of an
label: BODY

text: installment sale, see Which Parts To
label: BODY

text: Complete below.
label: BODY

text: Do not file Form 6252 to report sales
label: BODY

text: during the tax year of stock or securities
label: BODY

text: traded on an established securities
label: BODY

text: market. Instead, treat all payments as
label: BODY

text: received during this tax year.
label: BODY

text: Do not file Form 6252 if you elect not
label: BODY

text: to report the sale on the installment
label: BODY

text: method. To elect out, report the full
label: BODY

text: amount of the gain on a timely filed
label: BODY

text: return (including extensions) on Form
label: BODY

text: 4797 or the Schedule D for your tax
label: BODY

text: return, whichever applies. If you filed your
label: BODY

text: original return on time without making the
label: BODY

text: election, you can make the election on an
label: BODY

text: amended return filed no later than 6
label: BODY

text: months after the due date of your tax
label: BODY

text: return, excluding extensions. Write “Filed
label: BODY

text: pursuant to section 301.9100-2” at the
label: BODY

text: top of the amended return.
label: BODY

text: Which Parts To Complete
label: BODY

text: Year of Sale
label: BODY

text: Complete lines 1 through 4, Part I, and
label: BODY

text: Part II. If you sold property to a related
label: BODY

text: party during the year, also complete
label: BODY

text: Part III.
label: BODY

text: Special Rules
label: BODY

text: If any part of an installment payment you
label: BODY

text: received is for interest or original issue
label: BODY

text: discount, report that income on the
label: BODY

text: appropriate form or schedule. Do not
label: BODY

text: report interest received, carrying charges
label: BODY

text: received, or unstated interest on Form
label: BODY

text: 6252. See Pub. 537, Installment Sales,
label: BODY

text: for details on unstated interest.
label: BODY

text: A special rule applies to a first disposition
label: BODY

text: (sale or exchange) of property under the
label: BODY

text: installment method to a related party who
label: BODY

text: then makes a second disposition (sale,
label: BODY

text: exchange, gift, or cancellation of
label: BODY

text: installment note) before making all
label: BODY

text: payments on the first disposition. For this
label: BODY

text: purpose, a related party includes your
label: BODY

text: spouse, child, grandchild, parent,
label: BODY

text: brother, sister, or a related corporation,
label: BODY

text: S corporation, partnership, estate, or
label: BODY

text: trust. See section 453(f)(1) for more
label: BODY

text: details.
label: BODY

text: Under this rule, treat part or all of the
label: BODY

text: amount the related party realized (or the
label: BODY

text: fair market value (FMV) if the disposed
label: BODY

text: property is not sold or exchanged) from
label: BODY

text: the second disposition as if you received
label: BODY

text: it from the first disposition at the time of
label: BODY

text: the second disposition. Figure the gain, if
label: BODY

text: any, on lines 30 through 37. This rule
label: BODY

text: does not apply if any of the conditions
label: BODY

text: listed on line 29 are met.
label: BODY

text: For certain dispositions under the
label: BODY

text: installment method, if an installment
label: BODY

text: obligation is pledged as security on a
label: BODY

text: debt, the net proceeds of the secured
label: BODY

text: debt are treated as payment on the
label: BODY

text: installment obligation. However, the
label: BODY

text: amount treated as payment cannot be
label: BODY

text: more than the excess of the total
label: BODY

text: installment contract price over any
label: BODY

text: payments received under the contract
label: BODY

text: before the secured debt was obtained.
label: BODY

text: An installment obligation is pledged as
label: BODY

text: security on a debt to the extent that
label: BODY

text: payment of principal and interest on the
label: BODY

text: debt is directly secured by an interest in
label: BODY

text: the installment obligation. For sales after
label: BODY

text: December 16, 1999, payment on a debt
label: BODY

text: is treated as directly secured by an
label: BODY

text: interest in an installment obligation to the
label: BODY

text: extent an arrangement allows you to
label: BODY

text: satisfy all or part of the debt with the
label: BODY

text: installment obligation.
label: BODY

text: The pledge rule applies to any
label: BODY

text: installment sale after 1988 with a sales
label: BODY

text: price of over $150,000 except:
label: BODY

text: ●Personal use property disposed of by
label: BODY

text: an individual,
label: BODY

text: ●Timeshares and residential lots.
label: BODY

text: However, the pledge rule does not apply
label: BODY

text: to pledges made after December 17, 1987,
label: BODY

text: if the debt is incurred to refinance the
label: BODY

text: principal amount of a debt that was
label: BODY

text: outstanding on December 17, 1987, and
label: BODY

text: was secured by nondealer real property
label: BODY

text: installment obligations on that date and at
label: BODY

text: all times after that date until the refinancing.
label: BODY

text: This exception does not apply to the extent
label: BODY

text: that the principal amount of the debt
label: BODY

text: resulting from the refinancing exceeds the
label: BODY

text: principal amount of the refinanced debt
label: BODY

text: immediately before the refinancing. Also,
label: BODY

text: the pledge rule does not affect refinancing
label: BODY

text: due to the calling of a debt by the creditor if
label: BODY

text: the debt is then refinanced by a person
label: BODY

text: other than this creditor or someone related
label: BODY

text: to the creditor.
label: BODY

text: Section references are to the Internal
label: BODY

text: Revenue Code unless otherwise noted.
label: BODY

text: Do not file Form 6252 for sales that
label: BODY

text: do not result in a gain, even if you will
label: BODY

text: receive a payment in a tax year after the
label: BODY

text: year of sale. Instead, report the entire
label: BODY

text: sale on Form 4797, Sales of Business
label: BODY

text: Property, or the Schedule D for your tax
label: BODY

text: return, whichever applies.
label: BODY

text: Later Years
label: HH3

text: Complete lines 1 through 4 and Part II
label: BODY

text: for any year in which you receive a
label: BODY

text: payment from an installment sale.
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: Related Person
label: BODY

text: Pledge Rule
label: BODY

text: If you sold property other than a
label: BODY

text: marketable security to a related party
label: BODY

text: after May 14, 1980, complete Form 6252
label: BODY

text: for the year of sale and for 2 years after
label: BODY

text: the year of sale, even if you did not
label: BODY

text: receive a payment. Complete lines 1
label: BODY

text: through 4. Complete Part II for any year
label: BODY

text: during this 2-year period in which you
label: BODY

text: receive a payment from the sale.
label: BODY

text: Complete Part III for the 2 years after
label: BODY

text: the year of sale unless you received the
label: BODY

text: final payment during the tax year.
label: BODY

text: If you sold a marketable security to a
label: BODY

text: related party after May 14, 1980, and
label: BODY

text: before January 1, 1987, complete Form
label: BODY

text: 6252 for each year of the installment
label: BODY

text: agreement, even if you did not receive a
label: BODY

text: payment. Complete lines 1 through 4.
label: BODY

text: Complete Part II for any year in which
label: BODY

text: you receive a payment from the sale.
label: BODY

text: Complete Part III unless you received
label: BODY

text: the final payment during the tax year.
label: BODY

text: Generally, if you sell depreciable property
label: BODY

text: to a related person (as defined in section
label: BODY

text: 453(g)(3)), you cannot report the sale using
label: BODY

text: the installment method. For this purpose,
label: BODY

text: depreciable property is any property that
label: BODY

text: can be depreciated by a person or entity to
label: BODY

text: whom you transfer it. However, you can
label: BODY

text: use the installment method if you can
label: BODY

text: show to the satisfaction of the IRS that
label: BODY

text: avoidance of federal income taxes was not
label: BODY

text: one of the principal purposes of the sale
label: BODY

text: (for example, no significant tax deferral
label: BODY

text: benefits will result from the sale). If the
label: BODY

text: installment method does not apply, report
label: BODY

text: the sale on Schedule D or Form 4797,
label: BODY

text: whichever applies. Treat all payments you
label: BODY

text: will receive as if they were received in the
label: BODY

text: year of sale. Use FMV for any payment that
label: BODY

text: is contingent as to amount. If the FMV
label: BODY

text: cannot be readily determined, basis is
label: BODY

text: recovered ratably.
label: BODY

text: ●Farm property, and
label: BODY

text: After December 31, 1986, the
label: BODY

text: installment method is not available for
label: BODY

text: the sale of marketable securities.
label: BODY

text: Generally, you must pay interest on the
label: BODY

text: deferred tax related to any obligation
label: BODY

text: that arises during a tax year from the
label: BODY

text: disposition of property under the
label: BODY

text: installment method if:
label: BODY

text: ●The property had a sales price over
label: BODY

text: Interest on Deferred Tax
label: BODY

text: Page 3
label: BODY

text: See IRC 453(l) for more information on
label: BODY

text: the sale of timeshares and residential
label: BODY

text: lots under the installment method.

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY
